definition: A screening test for syphilis.
A computer check that shows if a patient's insurance is active and what it covers.
example_usage: Front desk staff run RTE before scheduling.

definition: A set amount of money a patient pays when they visit the doctor.
example_usage: Patient paid a $20 co-pay at check-in.

definition: The amount a patient must pay before their insurance starts paying for care.
example_usage: The patient has a $1500 deductible to meet.

definition: The percentage of the bill a patient pays after meeting their deductible.
A paper or online statement showing what the insurance paid and what the patient owes.
example_usage: Review the EOB to understand the claim payment.

definition: The most money a patient pays in one year before insurance covers everything.
example_usage: Patient has reached their $5000 OOP maximum.

definition: Permission from insurance needed before getting certain tests or treatments.

aliases:
{PA,{pre-authorization},{insurance,billing,approval}

definition: A type of insurance that requires you to use specific doctors and get referrals to see specialists.
example_usage: HMO patients need a referral to see specialists.

definition: An insurance plan that mixes HMO and PPO rules.
example_usage: POS plan requires PCP coordination but allows out-of-network.

definition: Government health insurance mainly for people 65 and older.
example_usage: Patient is eligible for Medicare Part B.

definition: Government health insurance for people with low income.
example_usage: Patient has Medicaid coverage for the visit.

definition: The monthly payment to keep an insurance plan active.

definition: Medical care and tests that an insurance plan will pay for.

definition: Services or treatments that insurance will not pay for.
Doctors and hospitals that have an agreement with your insurance company.
Doctors and hospitals that do not have an agreement with your insurance company.
example_usage: Out-of-network services cost more for patients.

definition: The maximum amount insurance will pay for a service.
example_usage: The allowable amount for the visit was $150.

definition: A request sent to insurance asking them to pay for services.
example_usage: Submit the claim within 30 days of service.

definition: An insurance request that was rejected and will not be paid.
example_usage: The claim was denied due to missing information.

definition: A common condition where stomach acid flows back into the throat causing heartburn.
example_usage: Patient diagnosed with GERD needs PPI medication.

definition: A checklist asking about symptoms in different parts of the body.

definition: When a doctor checks the patient's body by looking listening and touching.

definition: The name of the disease or condition the patient has.

definition: The main reason the patient came to see the doctor.

definition: White blood cells involved in allergic reactions.
A blood test checking electrolytes kidney function and blood sugar.

definition: A salt in blood that helps balance fluids and nerves.
A mineral critical for heart and muscle function.

definition: Measures bicarbonate which shows acid-base balance.

definition: A mineral important for bones nerves and muscles.
